summary: This document appears to be a brief internal communication or note regarding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It discusses a suggestion from a psychologist about housing Epstein with another sex offender in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and indicates the plan is to keep him in his current location.

persons.name: Dr. M.
persons.context: A psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center who contacted the author about a suggestion regarding housing Jeffrey Epstein with another sex offender in the SHU.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual at the center of the housing discussion, referred to as a sex offender.

connections.description: Dr. M., as Chief Psychologist at the correctional center, is professionally involved in assessing or making recommendations regarding Epstein's incarceration conditions.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.address: 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: The federal prison where Jeffrey Epstein was held; the location of the discussed housing plan.

locations.name: Special Housing Unit (SHU)
locations.context: A segregated unit within the prison mentioned as a potential location for housing Epstein with another sex offender.

keyFacts: A discussion occurred regarding housing Jeffrey Epstein with another sex offender in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Dr. M., the Chief Psychologist, suggested this housing arrangement, but the executive staff's plan was to keep Epstein in his current location 'down here for a bit'.
The document is an internal note or communication from a Bureau of Prisons official, indicating operational planning for Epstein's incarceration.
